full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 763 Filed 08/10/22 Page 171 of 197 2712 LCHVMAX6
1 admission that he vacated East 69th in or about January '96, and then Judge Chin's decision making that finding of fact.
2 There is one other document from that docket that we seek to admit, but under a separate rule of evidence, 804(b)(1).
3 There was actually a deposition transcript from Mr. Epstein in which he is asked -- and it was taken by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
4 And he was asked in that deposition, Is it correct that you moved from the premises -- meaning East 69th -- to 9 East 71st Street in or around the beginning of '96?
5 And Mr. Epstein responded, You asked me that question three times. I believe it is around then, but I don't know exactly when.
6 This deposition excerpt was appended to a pleading that was submitted by the U.S. Attorney's Office in support of their case at docket number 52. So I believe that one is admissible under 804(b)(1), the deposition transcript.
7 THE COURT: Okay. One at a time, Mr. Rohrbach.
8 MR. ROHRBACH: Yes, your Honor.
9 I will go through each of the documents, but just as a substantive point, this is very much like the 44 Kinnerton Street issues we've been talking about.
10 And substantively --
11 THE COURT: Microphone.
12 MR. ROHRBACH: This is very much like the 44 Kinnerton
13 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
14 DOJ-OGR-00014277
